docs.lead_paragraph: REINWALD--Charles Anthony Age 85, passed away due to prostate cancer June 2, 2011. Charles lived in Scarsdale NY from 1964-2004, and then in Tequesta, Florida. Charles was born in 1925, in Flushing Queens, New York to the late Charles Anthony Reinwald, Sr. and Estella Mary Brake Reinwald. He leaves his wife of 49 years, Anne, and three children: Charles, Jr. and his wife Sarah, Lisa Silverman and her husband Robert, and Andrea Dabbar and her husband Paul, and a sister, Shirley R. Johnson, and five grandchildren: Andrew, David and Samantha Silverman, and William and Katherine Dabbar. Charles graduated Yale Univ. in 1946 from Navy officer training program, attending during World War II, and received a degree in history. He received a law degree from NYU Law School in 1949. He was an attorney with Allstate Insurance Co. When both he and his wife were diagnosed with cancer in 1999, he founded the Cancer Cure Coalition, dedicated to the cure and prevention of cancer. The coalition made efforts in patient advocacy including hosting a conference, and sponsored journalistic research. He continued his work with stock investing, surveying new cancer treatments and working on a book on cancer treatments, and managing the Cancer Cure Coalition as long as his health permitted. He participated in in local government and organizations including the Scarsdale American Legion, and the Masons. He participated in chess clubs and tournaments and attained the rank of chess master. He was an avid reader with broad interests. He occasionally attended meetings of the Religious Society of Friends. Charles is remembered as caring, genuine, and brilliant. He always had a smile and a story to tell.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  REINWALD, CHARLES ANTHONY AGE 85

docs.lead_paragraph: The British drug maker AstraZeneca has settled in principle nearly all of the American product liability lawsuits over Seroquel, its blockbuster antipsychotic drug, the company said in a quarterly earnings report on Thursday. All but 250 of the 28,700 cases have been settled, most with written agreements, AstraZeneca said in the securities filing. It had previously reported settling most of those cases, but the new filing showed how far the company has whittled away at the remaining product liability litigation. Last quarter, it had reported 2,600 outstanding cases.

headline.main: AstraZeneca Has Settled Most of Its Seroquel Suits

docs.abstract: AstraZeneca has settled nearly all American product liability suits over Seroquel, its antipsychotic drug; all but 250 of 28,700 cases are settled, with payments averaging under $20,000 (M)
